production she may wind up with an over supply especially if she pumping right after feed she may have just been drained by baby get wanting bit of freezer stash or bottle in the fridge so someone feeding she still in stage of supply regulating and feeding the lo as much and as often as they want is the best way to get supply to match their needs otherwise all the comments offer great tips on boosting and maintaining supply she feels he does get enough when nursing because he still very hungry afterwards often downing 4+ ounces of formula had he lost weight or has there been something to warrant supplementing did see you reference if in your op if he at good weight and is making enough diapers maybe just trying cutting out the formula afterwards if he hungry he ll nurse more which is probably the hardest thing have done beside labor if did need to pump then did so did drink for year and was walking milk stand all needed was cowbell pumping was very hard on my supply too well at work would suggest she pump one additional time in the morning to build up the supply and demand she needs wait about an hour after feeding then pump for 10 15 minutes do not worry about baby not getting enough at that point she may have to deal with cluster feedings but she telling her body hey baby needs more the extra milk will be bonus or get netflix going and just let the little guy suckle for an hour or two this can create some bad habits but it would help with supply for sure the first three months did this several times and it seemed to help until let it fall off on side note my son sleeps in crib and does need milk to go to bed it just depends on how much you let bad habit go on for breastfeeding is so damned hard do think anyone should be surprised that formula is used so much and thank god for that we would have so many babies that were malnourished without it you know you are taking enough fenugreek when you start to smell of maple syrup you your milk your sweat your pee even baby will smell of maple my canadian side sees no problem with this like me she did like the taste nor texture of it you have to remember also that her milk supply is regulating around this time by about months my breasts no longer felt full even when it was time for feed unless baby had gone freakishly long time without nursing like 12 hours she might notice drop in production with the pump but that does mean that baby is getting what he needs it just means that her body has adapted to how much he eats and is making an oversupply anymore would really recommend using weight gain and diaper output as your guide before you jump to supplementing also he could be going through growth spurt which just means she should give him the breast more often not give him formula because then her supply wo adjust to his needs that makes sense with our older two she had no maternity leave yeah we live in the usa so her supply went bye bye almost instantly hopefully it just regulation this is my experience with breastfeeding breastfed my first for almost three years exclusively breast milk for the first months it would take me 45 mins of pumping to get maybe an ounce out and this was well after my supply was established and knew what the hell was doing the pump is just the devil and my body would not respond to it currently bfing our second and have even bothered to try with the pump this time tell your wife to hang in there and trust that her body knows what it doing at first had to play video of our son crying to help her produce while pumping maybe it time to set the pump down unless she needs relief how does she know she having problems producing milk it sounds like he gaining weight well but you re also supplementing why did you start supplementing are you joking ca tell but think it would be much more thoughtful and kind for you to make the cookies she under lot of physical and mental stress right now they are awesome in similar boat to op wife and ca guzzle oz out of bottle ll pump then and ll usually get about the same amount that he took from the bottle clearly it was there for the taking but my kid does seem to be able to get it all no matter how long he stays on the nipple supplementing began bit early weeks as she could keep up with him he was big baby to begin with and came with big appetite seriously ll eat those all day right now ve been do all can without killing myself including baking her some yum yums do her favour read through dr jack newman stuff start here http www breastfeedinginc ca content php pagename=doc imb and his elegantly stylized bottles they re never empty as long as the kid is suckling milk is being produced let down and going into the baby my daughter was well over 9lbs tiny there were quantity problems that not how it works if you need to increase your supply simply nurse more the feeling of engorgement indicates an *oversupply* this almost always goes away in reasonable amount of time as mom body figures out exactly how much is needed and the breasts return to feeling normal instead of swollen engorged etc and the supply is exactly as it should be at that point also be aware that virtually all cultures have suggestions about what to eat to make more milk http kellymom com bf can breastfeed herbs herbal galactagogue and they vary from culture to culture there no evidence to support the use of any sort of cookie beyond the fact that people like cookies and oatmeal is good for you in general http kellymom com bf got milk supply worries oatmeal there no point in drinking water beyond what she needs to satiate her thirst http kellymom com nutrition mothers diet mom calories fluids unless you are severely dehydrated drinking extra fluids beyond thirst is not beneficial may cause discomfort and does not increase milk supply better to get quality information and qualified in person help than making guesses and listening to folk wisdom as far as birth control goes the lactational amenorrhea method https www plannedparenthood org learn birth control breastfeeding is *very* effective *when practiced correctly* it seems every time it mentioned somebody helpfully offers not true had baby while nursing but it more complicated than just nurse there are rules to follow and if they do apply it not reliable contraception but if you are following the rules for lam she should not need the pill you might add barrier method like the sponge if you still want back up her problem might be the formula then bottles tend to be easier to eat from and formula takes longer to digest than breast milk if were her try cutting back on it and maybe try to nurse more often to make up for it also you may already be aware of it but if not you should look into paced bottle feeding babies will suck bottle down very quickly if given the opportunity and it is not always indicative of their hunger level that being said if she is still convinced it her birth control there are other options out there both the mirena and the hormone free iuds can be great with breast feeding best thing did for my milk supply was take boobie stay cation for days all did was lay in bed top less and have lo nurse around the clock he was pretty much attached to the boob for 72 hours my milk supply skyrocketed and did have any problems after that was on jolivette and it dried up my supply within month do know for sure if it related but tried everything everyone has listed here and it did work have her talk to her ob asap for real set down the pump if she staying at home the best thing she can do is let the baby muse nurse and nurse some more the birth control could be effecting her supply little but if the babes suckin on the boob all day her body should respond accordingly also the best way to know if they are getting enough is from diaper output and steady weight gain tiny babies are always hungry and breastmilk digests very quickly for the first months of my sons life he was pretty much attached to my nipple this sounds more like the formula is causing the issue verus the birth control the baby on the breast is whats going to tell your body to produce more milk supplementing is only going to tell your body you dont need that much milk and did need to supplement in the very beginning because my baby was big and my milk had come in the colostrum wasnt enough for him so do understand around weeks your body regulates itself so the breast feel less full but there is milk in there your body is just going to make just enough that your baby and the pump till it to she could be someone who doesnt respond as well to the pump does she massage her breasts while pumping is he actually hungry after the feedings or is he taking the bottle because its there and placed in his mouth is she using paced bottle feeding so he doesnt develop flow preference how long are the feeding sessions on the breast this morning he woke around 6am and she nursed him he was pretty calm afterwards ve shared the responses ve seen and am encouraging her to nurse whenever possible which is pretty much all the time during pumping and nursing she ll massage but during pumping it does almost nothing for flow after nursing he still be hungry we test this by poking the corners his mouth to make him search which he only does when hungry so she try nursing again but he would calm down if we got him some formula he start chugging until he was content he the furthest thing from tiny and was small baby our daughter was the little baby and her feeding were short but frequent will do as nice as that would be it not possible for us we have two older kids who are in school so she has to collect them in the afternoon if she stays in our room to nurse there no telling what chaos they ll cause tiny was good word choice lol more so meant newborn infant my toddler just seems so big now and the little ones are so tiny in comparison just always feel bad when mom wants to breastfeed and gets told wrong info because so many doctors unless they are super pro breastfeeding do know lot about the subject that being said if you guys feel he would benefit from supplementing then go for it you guys know your baby best dark beer and oatmeal cookies she also going to need to ditch the formula if she wants to keep producing to meet his needs breastfeeding is all supply and demand so any time your baby is nursing and getting nutrition elsewhere that signaling to her body that there no need for her to produce to meet that feeding session they ll go through many spurts at different ages where he ll need to nurse longer and more frequently to up her supply to meet his milk demand it normal if exhausting also keep in mind that he may guzzle oz of formula from bottle because it flows easier and he does have to work as hard to get it they tend to easily overeat this way look up paced bottle feeding for breastfed babies if you do continue with bottles drawing out the feed and making them pause frequently will more easily let their tummies catch up and realize when they are full breastfed babies also eat much differently than formula fed babies around months old my daughter would eat maybe oz every hours or so breastmilk is digested in 90ish minutes so they eat smaller amounts more frequently it was until my kid turned months old that she started eating oz at time she months old now and still only takes oz at each feeding bottle feeding takes less work on their end than nursing and goes much quicker sounds like he showing nipple preference because he getting used to the ease of bottle feeding try cutting out bottles for week or two and see if that helps
